Description: Unique identifier for each job posting.
The nursing specialty required for the position (e.g., ICU, ER, Med-Surg, Labor & Delivery, Pediatrics).
The state where the job is located (e.g., California, Texas, New York, etc.).
Duration of the contract in weeks (e.g., 4, 8, 13, 26 weeks).
Hourly wage offered for the position ($ per hour).
Weekly stipend provided for travel and housing ($ per week).
Type of shift required (Day, Night, Rotating).
Type of hospital where the job is located (Teaching, Community, Private, Government).
Number of beds available in the hospital.
Number of years of nursing experience required or preferred.
Specific certification required for the role (e.g., BLS, ACLS, PALS, TNCC, CEN, CCRN).
Rating of the staffing agency on a scale of 3.0 to 5.0.
Indicates whether the nurse has prior travel nursing experience (0 = No, 1 = Yes).
Indicates whether the job posting was successfully filled (0 = Not filled, 1 = Filled).
The frequency of the certification in the dataset, indicating how common or rare it is.
